trans-unit.source: There are two options for moving from Mobile Services to App Service: migration or upgrade.
trans-unit.target: There are two options for moving from Mobile Services to App Service: migration or upgrade.

trans-unit.source: Either option will give you access to all of the hosting capabilities of App Service:
trans-unit.target: Either option will give you access to all of the hosting capabilities of App Service:

trans-unit.source: *Migrating* a service just changes the underlying environment that hosts your mobile backend.
trans-unit.target: *Migrating* a service just changes the underlying environment that hosts your mobile backend.

trans-unit.source: It requires **no code changes** to either the mobile client or the mobile server project.
trans-unit.target: It requires **no code changes** to either the mobile client or the mobile server project.

trans-unit.source: If you use the automated migration option, this preserves your **service.azure-mobile.net** URL.
trans-unit.target: If you use the automated migration option, this preserves your **service.azure-mobile.net** URL.

trans-unit.source: *Upgrading* a service does **require code changes** to both your server and client project, but allows you to take advantage of new mobile SDK features, such as improvements to authentication and more flexibility for your server project.
trans-unit.target: *Upgrading* a service does **require code changes** to both your server and client project, but allows you to take advantage of new mobile SDK features, such as improvements to authentication and more flexibility for your server project.
